activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor Raul Garcia Castro

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on November 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.

2:03 PM Defendant Victor Raul Garcia Castro appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to file petition for court appointed attorney. Matter to be set for indigency hearing.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:04 AM Defendant Victor Raul Garcia Castro in court.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Address verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Court orders Signature bond in the amount of $1,000 to be signed by October 21, 2022 with conditions: Maintain absolute sobriety. No intentional contact with animals. Defendant ordered to contact Public Defender's office. Adjourned initial appearance set for November 2, 2022 at 1:00 pm
No intentional contact with any animals. Maintain absolute sobriety.
Initial appearance on October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
